00040 /* 
00041 ==========================================================
00042    Compiler directives
00043 ==========================================================
00044 */
00045 
00046 /* deprecated attribute */
00047 #ifdef __GNUC__
00048         #define DEPRECATED(func) func __attribute__ ((deprecated))
00049 #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
00050         #define DEPRECATED(func) __declspec(deprecated) func
00051 #else
00052         #pragma message("WARNING: You need to implement DEPRECATED for this compiler")
00053         #define DEPRECATED(func) func
00054 #endif
00055 
00056 #if defined(OPJ_STATIC) || !defined(_WIN32)
00057 /* http://gcc.gnu.org/wiki/Visibility */
00058 #if __GNUC__ >= 4
00059 #define OPJ_API    __attribute__ ((visibility ("default")))
00060 #define OPJ_LOCAL  __attribute__ ((visibility ("hidden")))
00061 #else
00062 #define OPJ_API
00063 #define OPJ_LOCAL
00064 #endif
00065 #define OPJ_CALLCONV
00066 #else
00067 #define OPJ_CALLCONV __stdcall
00068 /*
00069 The following ifdef block is the standard way of creating macros which make exporting 
00070 from a DLL simpler. All files within this DLL are compiled with the OPJ_EXPORTS
00071 symbol defined on the command line. this symbol should not be defined on any project
00072 that uses this DLL. This way any other project whose source files include this file see 
00073 OPJ_API functions as being imported from a DLL, wheras this DLL sees symbols
00074 defined with this macro as being exported.
00075 */
00076 #if defined(OPJ_EXPORTS) || defined(DLL_EXPORT)
00077 #define OPJ_API __declspec(dllexport)
00078 #else
00079 #define OPJ_API __declspec(dllimport)
00080 #endif /* OPJ_EXPORTS */
00081 #endif /* !OPJ_STATIC || !_WIN32 */
00082 
00083 typedef int OPJ_BOOL;
00084 #define OPJ_TRUE 1
00085 #define OPJ_FALSE 0

00088 typedef float         OPJ_FLOAT32;

00185         OPJ_RLCP = 1,                   
00186         OPJ_RPCL = 2,                   
00187         OPJ_PCRL = 3,                   
00188         OPJ_CPRL = 4                    
00189 } OPJ_PROG_ORDER;

00482  * Callback function prototype for read function
00483  */

00485

00487  * Callback function prototype for write function
00488  */

00491 /*
00492  * Callback function prototype for skip function
